alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Collier and northern Mainland Monroe Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Carnestown, or 7 miles northeast of Chokoloskee, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chokoloskee, Everglades City, Plantation Island, Carnestown, Copeland, Big Cypress National Preserve, Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve and Jerome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe
